thread.title: Jose Mourinho better manager than Pep Guardiola insists Aitor Karanka — on eve of Middlesbrough vs Manchester City!
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho better manager than Pep Guardiola insists Aitor Karanka — on eve of Middlesbrough vs Manchester City!

author: Jason Mellor
title: Jose Mourinho better manager than Pep Guardiola insists Aitor Karanka — on eve of Middlesbrough vs Manchester City!
text:
Jose Mourinho better manager than Pep Guardiola insists Aitor Karanka — on eve of Middlesbrough vs Manchester City! Boro boss may have done Blues counterpart's FA Cup quarter-final team-talk for him by backing his pal Share Mourinho's old Real Madrid assistant Karanka picks him over fellow Spaniard Guardiola (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Share Get football   Could   
Pep Guardiola is just a poor man’s Jose Mourinho. 
That is the opinion of Aitor Karanka, the coach trying to knock his Manchester City side out of the FA Cup this weekend. 
There is little love lost between Karanka, Mourinho’s former Real Madrid number two, and Barca legend Guardiola after they previously crossed swords in La Liga. 
Mourinho is already one up on his cross-city rival in the silverware stakes this season after Manchester United’s League Cup final success. 
And Middlesbrough manager Karanka said: “Is Pep the best coach in the world? No. The best coach in the world is Jose Mourinho . Mourinho and Guardiola were rivals in Spain and now battle for Mancunian bragging rights (Photo: Man Utd/Getty) Read More 
“He has shown it during his career at Porto, at Inter Milan, Chelsea, Real Madrid and Manchester United. 
"He was the best in Spain, and he still is the best. 
“Jose started this season with some criticism, but he has already won a trophy for United. Jose is the best for me. 
“I think Guardiola has to win the Premier League to show he is one of the best ever. 
"He has shown he can win titles in Spain and in Germany, and he probably thought he’d do the same in England.” Guardiola won trophies galore as boss of Barcelona and (above) Bayern Munich (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) Read More Karanka sure chairman Gibson is still in his corner despite "really bad" fortnight 
Karanka reckons the Premier League has been a culture shock to the former Barca and Bayern Munich boss, whose third-place side trail leaders Chelsea by 10 points going into the last 11 league games. 
He added: “I think he’s realised that this is a different football, a different league, and he has grasped how difficult the challenge is. It’s taking him time to adapt and it’s not been easy for him. 
“It’s difficult when you arrive in a new country, with a new philosophy where a lot of things are different. He has some very good players, but the mentality here is different. Things are different and it takes time to adjust.” 
Karanka is yet to finish on the losing side in two previous encounters with Man City —including a famous FA Cup win for then-Championship Boro at the Etihad Stadium two years ago. Karanka's Boro went to Man City in the FA Cup and won in January 2015 (Photo: Getty) Read More Karanka faces striker crisis as the goals dry up for out-of-sorts Middlesbrough 
He will bury the hatchet and offer his rival a drop of traditional Catalan sparkling wine Cava when inviting him into his office for a quick bite to eat after Saturday’s lunchtime kickoff. 
“He was frustrated when we earned a draw at theirs earlier this season," said Karanka, "and hopefully we can give another good account of ourselves on Saturday.” poll loading Who's the best manager, Jose Mourinho and Pep Guardiola? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
